message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CY 

This paper is about automated sentiment classification of tweets, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). The paper also discusses the role of human annotators in creating training data for the classification models. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). 

The paper also uses machine learning techniques to construct the classification models, which falls under the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). 

The paper discusses the quality and size of training data, which is a common topic in the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

The paper also mentions the need to monitor the self- and inter-annotator agreements, which is related to the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval). 

Finally, the paper analyzes the perception of sentiment classes by humans, which is related to the sub-category of cs.CY (Computers and Society).
